name: py-arm-pyart

variants.name: build_system
variants.description: Build systems supported by the package

variants.name: wradlib
variants.description: Calculate texture of differential phase field

description:
Python ARM Radar Toolkit. A growing collection of weather radar
algorithms and utilities build on top of the Scientific Python stack and
distributed under the 3-Clause BSD license. Py-ART is used by the
Atmospheric Radiation Measurement (ARM) Climate Research Facility for
working with data from a number of precipitation and cloud radars, but
has been designed so that it can be used by others in the radar and
atmospheric communities to examine, processes, and analyse data from
many types of weather radars.

dependencies.name: gdal
dependencies.description:
GDAL: Geospatial Data Abstraction Library. GDAL is a translator library
for raster and vector geospatial data formats that is released under an
MIT style Open Source License by the Open Source Geospatial Foundation.
As a library, it presents a single raster abstract data model and single
vector abstract data model to the calling application for all supported
formats. It also comes with a variety of useful command line utilities
for data translation and processing.

dependencies.name: py-cartopy
dependencies.description: Cartopy - a cartographic python library with matplotlib support.

dependencies.name: py-cftime
dependencies.description:
Python library for decoding time units and variable values in a netCDF
file conforming to the Climate and Forecasting (CF) netCDF conventions

dependencies.name: py-cylp
dependencies.description:
A Python interface for CLP, CBC, and CGL. CyLP is a Python interface to
COIN-OR's Linear and mixed-integer program solvers (CLP, CBC, and CGL).
CyLP's unique feature is that you can use it to alter the solution
process of the solvers from within Python.

dependencies.name: py-cython
dependencies.description: The Cython compiler for writing C extensions for the Python language.

dependencies.name: py-fsspec
dependencies.description: A specification for pythonic filesystems.

dependencies.name: py-h5py
dependencies.description:
The h5py package provides both a high- and low-level interface to the
HDF5 library from Python.

dependencies.name: py-matplotlib
dependencies.description:
Matplotlib is a comprehensive library for creating static, animated, and
interactive visualizations in Python.

dependencies.name: py-netcdf4
dependencies.description: Python interface to the netCDF Library.

dependencies.name: py-numpy
dependencies.description: Fundamental package for array computing in Python.

dependencies.name: py-pandas
dependencies.description:
pandas is a fast, powerful, flexible and easy to use open source data
analysis and manipulation tool, built on top of the Python programming
language.

dependencies.name: py-pip
dependencies.description: The PyPA recommended tool for installing Python packages.

dependencies.name: py-pooch
dependencies.description:
Pooch manages your Python library's sample data files: it automatically
downloads and stores them in a local directory, with support for
versioning and corruption checks.

dependencies.name: py-pylab-sdk
dependencies.description: A development kit that collects simple utilities.

dependencies.name: py-s3fs
dependencies.description:
S3FS builds on aiobotocore to provide a convenient Python filesystem
interface for S3.

dependencies.name: py-scipy
dependencies.description: Fundamental algorithms for scientific computing in Python.

dependencies.name: py-setuptools
dependencies.description:
A Python utility that aids in the process of downloading, building,
upgrading, installing, and uninstalling Python packages.

dependencies.name: py-setuptools-scm
dependencies.description: The blessed package to manage your versions by scm tags.

dependencies.name: py-wheel
dependencies.description: A built-package format for Python.

dependencies.name: py-wradlib
dependencies.description:
wradlib is designed to assist you in the most important steps of
processing weather radar data. These may include: reading common data
formats, georeferencing, converting reflectivity to rainfall intensity,
identifying and correcting typical error sources (such as clutter or
attenuation) and visualising the data.

dependencies.name: py-xarray
dependencies.description: N-D labeled arrays and datasets in Python

dependencies.name: python
dependencies.description: The Python programming language.

dependencies.name: python-venv

dependencies.name: rsl
dependencies.description:
This library is an object oriented programming environment for writing
software applicable to all RADAR data related to the TRMM GV effort.
